intro: Henckelia flavescens, commonly known as the golden henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Henckelia flavescens is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
